label: Engineer
description: A professional member of the engineering profession expected to exhibit highest standards of honesty and integrity in their work
text_references: As members of this profession, engineers are expected to exhibit the highest standards of honesty and integrity
Engineers, in the fulfillment of their professional duties, shall

label: Client
description: An individual or organization that receives engineering services and to whom engineers owe duties of loyalty and confidentiality
text_references: Act for each employer or client as faithful agents or trustees
Do not disclose client/employer information without consent

label: Employer
description: An organization or individual that employs engineers and to whom engineers owe duties of loyalty and faithful service
text_references: Act for each employer or client as faithful agents or trustees
Notify employer before accepting outside work

label: Public
description: The general population whose safety, health, and welfare engineers must hold paramount
text_references: Hold paramount the safety, health, and welfare of the public
must be dedicated to the protection of the public health, safety, and welfare

label: Safety
description: The fundamental principle of protecting people from harm or danger in engineering work
text_references: Hold paramount the safety, health, and welfare of the public
must be dedicated to the protection of the public health, safety, and welfare

label: Honesty
description: The ethical principle of truthfulness and transparency in all professional dealings
text_references: engineers are expected to exhibit the highest standards of honesty and integrity
Engineers shall be guided by honesty and integrity

label: Integrity
description: The principle of moral uprightness and consistency in professional conduct
text_references: engineers are expected to exhibit the highest standards of honesty and integrity
Engineers shall be guided by honesty and integrity

label: Competence
description: The principle that engineers should only work within their areas of expertise and qualification
text_references: Perform services only in areas of their competence
Accept only qualified assignments

label: Impartiality
description: The principle of being fair and unbiased in professional judgment and conduct
text_references: the services provided by engineers require honesty, impartiality, fairness, and equity

label: Fairness
description: The principle of treating all parties justly and equitably
text_references: the services provided by engineers require honesty, impartiality, fairness, and equity
Treat all individuals with fairness and respect

label: Hold paramount public welfare
description: The fundamental obligation to prioritize public safety, health, and welfare above all other considerations
text_references: Hold paramount the safety, health, and welfare of the public

label: Maintain competence
description: The duty to work only within areas of expertise and maintain professional qualifications
text_references: Perform services only in areas of their competence
Commit to ongoing professional development

label: Maintain confidentiality
description: The duty to protect client and employer information from unauthorized disclosure
text_references: Do not disclose client/employer information without consent
Engineers shall maintain confidentiality

label: Act as faithful agent
description: The duty to serve clients and employers with loyalty and trustworthiness
text_references: Act for each employer or client as faithful agents or trustees

label: Avoid deceptive acts
description: The duty to refrain from misleading, fraudulent, or dishonest conduct
text_references: Avoid deceptive acts
Engineers shall avoid conduct that deceives the public

label: Professional conduct
description: The state of adhering to ethical standards and professional behavior requirements
text_references: Engineers must perform under a standard of professional behavior that requires adherence to the highest principles of ethical conduct

label: Conflict of interest
description: A situation where personal or financial interests may compromise professional judgment
text_references: Disclose actual or potential conflicts of interest
Engineers shall not be influenced by conflicting interests

label: Area of competence
description: The specific field or domain where an engineer has sufficient knowledge and skills
text_references: Perform services only in areas of their competence
Do not sign off on work outside area of expertise

label: Engineering documents
description: Technical documentation, plans, specifications, and reports produced in engineering work
text_references: Approve only engineering documents conforming to standards

label: Confidential information
description: Proprietary or sensitive data belonging to clients or employers that must be protected
text_references: Do not share confidential information without consent
Do not disclose client/employer information without consent

label: Professional standards
description: Established criteria and requirements that engineering work must meet
text_references: Approve only engineering documents conforming to standards

label: Notify appropriate authorities
description: The action of informing relevant officials when safety or legal violations occur
text_references: Notify employer or client and appropriate authority if judgment is overruled endangering life/property

label: Disclose conflicts
description: The action of revealing actual or potential conflicts of interest to relevant parties
text_references: Disclose actual or potential conflicts of interest
Disclose affiliations when speaking for interested parties

label: Report violations
description: The action of informing authorities about code violations or unethical conduct
text_references: Report known code violations to professional or public bodies

label: Accept responsibility
description: The action of acknowledging accountability for one's professional actions and decisions
text_references: Engineers shall accept responsibility for their actions

label: Judgment overruled endangering safety
description: An occurrence where professional safety recommendations are rejected, creating danger
text_references: Notify employer or client and appropriate authority if judgment is overruled endangering life/property

label: Code violations
description: Incidents where engineering or legal codes and standards are not followed
text_references: Report known code violations to professional or public bodies

label: Professional errors
description: Mistakes or failures in engineering work that require acknowledgment and correction
text_references: Admit and correct errors

label: Professional judgment
description: The ability to make sound technical and ethical decisions based on expertise and principles
text_references: Notify employer or client and appropriate authority if judgment is overruled endangering life/property

label: Technical expertise
description: The specialized knowledge and skills required to perform engineering work competently
text_references: Do not sign off on work outside area of expertise
Express opinions based on facts and competence

label: Communication skills
description: The ability to convey technical information objectively and truthfully to various audiences
text_references: Issue public statements only in an objective and truthful manner
